text.p: QAD Inc filed Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission an initial public offering to sell up to 5.75 million common shares.

Of the total amount, QAD will offer 4.6 million in the United States and Canada and 1.15 million elsewhere, the Carpinteria, Calif.,-based company said in the filing. After the offering, outstanding common will total 28,274,234 common.
The price for the initial stock offering is estimated at $12 to $14 per common share, QAD said.

The company granted the underwriters a 30-day over-allotment option to purchase up to 862,500 additional common shares. The offering will be made through Smith Barney Inc and Robertson, Stephens & Co.
Net proceeds will be used for repayment of debt, to fund capital and other investments and for working capital and general corporate purposes.
The company has applied to Nasdaq to trade under the symbol "QADI".
QAD is a provider of Enterprise Resource Planning software for multinational and other large manufacturing companies.
